sentences.sContent: I had blisters on the soles of my feet .
I dropped a glass earlier, so don’t walk around in bare feet .
sentences.sCn: 我刚才打破了一个玻璃杯，所以不要光着脚到处走。

sentences.sContent: The vet examined the horse’s hind feet .
He walked to the foot of the stairs.
He’s six feet tall , with blonde hair.
sentences.sCn: 他身高六英尺，一头金发。

sentences.sContent: ...on the first day he sets foot in a school building...
...People were always proud to be from Piedmont—lying at the foot of a mountain...
...the extra time and money spent pursuing a college diploma will leave them worse off than they were before they set foot on campus...
...Houses built before 1939 use about 50% more energy per square foot than those built after 2000...
...on the first day he sets foot in the school building...

phrases.pCn: 手脚一起；完全地；无微不至地
成功的第一步，成功地开始
以不好的方式开始，出师不利
以好的方式开始；开张大吉；开门红

words.tran: 英尺长度；连续镜头；以尺计算长度
基础；立足处；社会关系；合计
步行；在…上行走；总计（foot的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on
